screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .scratch file in MIT Scratch 0.x
screenshot.caption: SCRATCH file open in MIT Scratch 0.x

description: Scratch is a popular development environment that children and other novice developers use to learn how to code. MIT released the original version of Scratch, known as Scratch 0.x, in 2003.
Scratch 0.x saved users' development projects as SCRATCH files. These files are binary files that contain the project's Scratch source code and other assets, translated into binary data.

images.alt: Screenshot of a .scratch file in MIT Scratch 0.x
images.caption: SCRATCH file open in MIT Scratch 0.x
